quote: A duty dodged is like a debt unpaid; it is only deferred, and we must come back and settle the account at last.
A man in debt is so far a slave.
A national debt, if it is not excessive, will be to us a national blessing.
A promise made is a debt unpaid.
Blessed are the young for they shall inherit the national debt.
But learn that to die is a debt we must all pay.
Debt is the prolific mother of folly and of crime.
Debt is the worst poverty.
Debt, n. An ingenious substitute for the chain and whip of the slavedriver.
Do not accustom yourself to consider debt only as an inconvenience. You will find it a calamity.
In the midst of life we are in debt.
Just praise is only a debt, but flattery is a present.
A duty dodged is like a debt unpaid; it is only deferred, and we must come back and settle the account at last.
A man in debt is so far a slave.
A national debt, if it is not excessive, will be to us a national blessing.
A promise made is a debt unpaid.
Blessed are the young for they shall inherit the national debt.
But learn that to die is a debt we must all pay.
Debt is the prolific mother of folly and of crime.
Debt is the worst poverty.
Debt, n. An ingenious substitute for the chain and whip of the slavedriver.
Do not accustom yourself to consider debt only as an inconvenience. You will find it a calamity.
In the midst of life we are in debt.
Just praise is only a debt, but flattery is a present.
Never run into debt, not if you can find anything else to run into.
Rather go to bed with out dinner than to rise in debt.
Science does not know its debt to imagination.
Some people use one half their ingenuity to get into debt, and the other half to avoid paying it.
There are but two ways of paying debt: Increase of industry in raising income, increase of thrift in laying out.
There is nothing that puts a man more in your debt than that he owes you nothing.
This would be a much better world if more married couples were as deeply in love as they are in debt.
Wars are made to make debt.
We owe a deep debt of gratitude to Adam, the first great benefactor of the human race: he brought death into the world.
What can be added to the happiness of a man who is in health, out of debt, and has a clear conscience?
Worrying is like paying on a debt that may never come due.
